;空间站生态系统星载热辐射计实验 (ECOSTRESS) 是一项科学任务，自成立以来收集高时空分辨率（∼70 m，平均重访时间 1-5 天）热图像。该项目于 2018 年 6 月 29 日启动。作为未来任务的前身，ECOSTRESS 的主要目标之一是检索和了解陆地蒸散量 (ET) 的时空变化及其对土壤水分可用性和大气干旱度的响应。在欧洲ECOSTRESS Hub（EEH）中，利用地表温度反演的优势，我们使用表面能量平衡系统（SEBS）和两源能量平衡三种具有不同结构和参数化方案的模型生成了欧洲和非洲的ECOSTRESS ET产品(TSEB) 参数模型，以及非参数表面温度启动闭合 (STIC) 模型。根据欧洲 6 个不同干旱水平生物群落的 19 个涡流协方差点的通量测量结果，对 EEH ET 产品进行了全面评估。结果显示 STIC 和 SEBS 的性能相当（RMSE 为 ∼70 W m;-2;）。然而，相对复杂的 TSEB 模型产生了较高的 RMSE，为 ∼90 W m;-2;。 STIC ET 估计值与 NASA PT-JPL 模型的运行 ECOSTRESS ET 产品之间的比较显示，PT-JPL ET 估计值的 RMSE 较大（高出约 50 W m;-2;）。 PT-JPL ET 估计中的大量高估（>;80 W m;-2;）在灌木丛和稀树草原上很明显，可能是由于模型中 LST 的约束较弱。总体而言，EEH 支持未来高分辨率热任务的 ET 检索。

Abstract Persistent deficits in meteorological, hydrological and ecological variables define different types of drought that are often linked together in a cascade. The drought cascade is an emergent phenomenon in the climatic system. A quantitative evaluation of the drought cascade based on observations is both a rigorous test of how different components of numerical Earth System models interact with one‐another and a useful tool for practitioners concerned with drought impacts on water resource and ecosystem services. In this study the drought cascade is characterized over the continental US using remote sensing data and in situ observations. Remote sensing fields of coincident vegetation photosynthesis and above‐ground biomass anomalies are introduced into the cascade to assess the role of the terrestrial biosphere within the cascade. The propagation of the diverse drought types, in terms of amplitude‐dampening and phase‐delays, are quantified. It is shown that woody and herbaceous vegetation have contrasting responses to prolonged soil moisture deficit that is traceable to access and storage of water as well as the dual effects of water‐ and light‐limitation. More importantly, WRF-Hydro streamflow fidelity also increases, especially in the case where the model domain is set up with SSURGO-informed total soil thickness. The magnitude and timing of peak flow events are better captured, ;r; increases across nine United States Geological Survey stream gages, and the mean KGE across seven of the nine gages increases from 0.12 to 0.66. Our pre-calibration parameter estimate approach, which is transferable to other spatially-distributed hydrological models, can substantially improve a model's performance, helping reduce calibration efforts and computational costs.
